content: title:[Seminar] Sep 30 (Mon) 14：00, Roy Ka-Wei Lee (Singapore University of Technology and Design) date:2024-09-19T00:00:00Z link:https://cs.kaist.ac.kr/board/view?bbs_id=events&bbs_sn=11208&page=1&skey=&svalue=&menu=86 content:We are pleased to invite you to the upcoming seminar on September 30th (Monday), at 14:00, by Prof. Roy Ka-Wei Lee (Singapore University of Technology and Design), titled "Online Trust & Safety Series: Countering Online Hate Speech with AI". Further details about the seminar and the speaker can be found below. Please feel free to share this email with anyone or any group at KAIST who might be interested in attending. Speaker: Roy Ka-Wei Lee Title: Online Trust & Safety Series: Countering Online Hate Speech with AI When: September 30th (Monday), 14:00 Where (offline): Information & Electronics Building (E3-1) Rm. 4443 (OSS Multimedia Clasroom) / 전산학동 (E3-1) 4443호 오상수영상강의실 Where (online): https://kaist.zoom.us/my/aliceatkaist Host: Alice Oh We are looking forward to seeing you at the talk！ Best regards, Haneul ==================== Here is the abstract of the talk and the speaker's biography. Abstract: As hate speech proliferates across digital platforms, the challenge of identifying and mitigating harmful content has become a critical issue for online trust and safety. In this talk, we explore how artificial intelligence (AI) is being leveraged to counter online hate speech effectively. We will examine the latest advancements in AI-driven content moderation, with a particular focus on detecting nuanced and context-dependent forms of hate, such as in memes and multilingual content. By addressing ethical challenges, including biases in AI models and the need for cultural sensitivity, this session will provide insights into how AI can balance the fine line between protecting free speech and fostering safer online communities. Bio: Roy Ka-Wei Lee is an Assistant Professor at the Information Systems Technology and Design Pillar, Singapore University of Technology and Design. His research focuses on the intersection of data mining, computational social science, social computing, and natural language processing. Roy's particular interest lies in understanding user behaviours across multiple social networks and promoting online safety. Because of his efforts in designing solutions that combat online hate speech and misinformation, Roy has been appointed Adjunct Senior Scientist at Singapore's Centre for Advanced Technologies in Online Safety (CATOS). Roy is currently leading the Social AI Studio, a dedicated research group that strives to develop cutting-edge social artificial intelligence systems. His work has been recognized and published in renowned conferences and journals. Roy also actively contributes to the academic community by serving on program committees and acting as a reviewer for these esteemed conferences and journals. Roy is an IEEE Senior Member. location: E3-1 Rm. 4443 (OSS Multimedia Clasroom) tag:csweb.calendar
